Participants.evidence: The prospective study included patients who underwent thyroid FNAB at the Endocrinology Clinic of Sultan Abdulhamid Training and Research Hospital

Objective.evidence: We aimed to determine whether a correlation exists between patients’ situational anxiety, pain perception and non-diagnostic cytology results.

Method_Outcome.evidence: We evaluated whether the STAI-S and VAS score is related to non-diagnostic results.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of the 119 patients included in the study, 98 were female, and 21 were male.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A statistically significant relation was found between the patient's STAI-S score and VAS score and the cytology result of non-diagnostic (p= 0.001 and p=0.008). In univariate logistic regression, high pre-procedural anxiety (OR:3.09, 95% CI:1.07-8.94, P =0.037) and VAS score (OR:1.57, 95% CI: 1.17-2.10, P =0.002) were associated with non-diagnostic cytology.
